skill.name: structlog
skill.description: Structured logging for Python applications with context support and powerful processors
skill.summary: Structured logging for Python applications with context support and powerful processors
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: All 48 static findings are false positives. The structlog skill contains only documentation for a legitimate Python logging library with Python code examples. The scanner misidentified Python %s string formatting as shell backticks, JSON metadata as cryptographic patterns, and SHA-256 hashes as C2 indicators. No malicious code, command execution, or security threats exist.

content.user_title: Add Structured Logging to Python Apps
content.value_statement: Python applications often produce unstructured log messages that are difficult to analyze and debug. Structlog transforms logs into structured data with context, making debugging faster and log analysis more reliable.
actual_capabilities: Configure structured logging with context binding for Python applications
Output logs as JSON for production environments
Integrate with Python standard logging module
Create custom log processors for specialized formatting
Handle exceptions with enhanced traceback formatting
Test logging behavior with built-in LogCapture utility
limitations: Requires Python 3.8 or later for full feature support
Does not include built-in log rotation or transport
ConsoleRenderer colors may not work in all terminal environments

use_cases.title: Production Log Management
use_cases.description: Configure JSON logging for structured log analysis in production environments with request context.

use_cases.title: Faster Debugging
use_cases.description: Add context binding to track request_id and user_id through complex application flows.

use_cases.title: Logging Tests
use_cases.description: Write unit tests that verify log output using LogCapture for assertion-based testing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up structlog with JSON output and bind request_id context for our Python web application.

prompt_templates.title: Console Debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure structlog with ConsoleRenderer and colors for development debugging.

prompt_templates.title: Exception Tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Add exception handling with dict_tracebacks processor to capture detailed error information.

prompt_templates.title: Testing Logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Write pytest tests using LogCapture to verify log messages include expected context data.

output_examples.input: Set up structlog with context binding for request tracking
output: Configured structlog with JSONRenderer for production
Bound request_id and user_id to logger context
All subsequent log calls automatically include bound context
Log output includes: event, timestamp, request_id, user_id

output_examples.input: Configure structlog for development with colored console output
output: Added timestamper with local time format

output_examples.input: Add exception handling to capture detailed errors
output: Exception details captured as structured data
Error context preserved in log output
Stack traces include local variable values

best_practices: Configure structlog once at application startup and reuse the same configuration
Bind context early in request handling with relevant identifiers like request_id
Use JSONRenderer for production and ConsoleRenderer for development environments
anti_patterns: Creating new logger configurations for each log call instead of reusing bound loggers
Logging sensitive data like passwords or tokens in structured logs
Using slow processors like ConsoleRenderer in high-throughput production systems

faq.question: What is structlog?
faq.answer: Structlog is a Python library that transforms logging into structured data with context support.

faq.question: Why use JSON logging?
faq.answer: JSON logs are easy to parse, search, and analyze with log aggregation tools like ELK or Splunk.

faq.question: How does context binding work?
faq.answer: Context binding attaches key-value pairs that persist across all subsequent log calls from that logger.

faq.question: Can structlog work with standard logging?
faq.answer: Yes, structlog provides stdlib integration to bridge with Python's standard logging module.

faq.question: Is structlog safe for production?
faq.answer: Yes, structlog is widely used in production and includes performance-optimized processors.

faq.question: Does structlog support async Python?
faq.answer: Yes, structlog works with async applications and includes async-compatible processors.
